title: Gangster who killed dad-of-two over minor bump on road has sentenced increased
text:
Mohammed was part of a gang who stabbed to death dad-of two Zakir Nawaz in Birmingham (Picture: West Midlands Police)

A member of a gang who stabbed to death a father from Birmingham has had his sentence nearly doubled after a legal appeal.

Warsame Mohammed was jailed for four and a half years in July after his crew hunted down and killed dad-of-two Zakir Nawaz, after a minor car crash.

He died just days before the birth of his youngest son.

Yesterday, the Court of Appeal increased this to seven years, as his original stretch was considered too lenient by the Solicitor General.

Mohammed, now aged 24, first stood trial for murder later pleaded guilty to manslaughter.

Birmingham Crown Court heard earlier this year how Mr Nawaz, 21, was attacked in Birmingham’s Washwood Heath area in September 2016.

Warsame Mohammed before the attack (Picture: West Midlands Police)

Mohamed and two other men were in a vehicle which had earlier collided with the victim’s hire car.

The court heard how the trio were set on revenge, and looked for vehicle involved in the minor crash.

Mr Nawaz, from Stechford, east Birmingham, was out with an old school friend when the pair were attacked outside a restaurant by the gang.

After punching and kicking him for some time, one of the men fatally stabbed him as he tried to make his escape.

Although Mohamed did not deliver the fatal blow, the court heard how joined in with beating up Mr Nawaz.

At the time, police said he was complicit in the killing as he knew one of his fellow gang members was carrying a blade.

The trial was delayed after Mohamed of Winson Green, Birmingham, fled the country, along with Abdulahi Shire, the man suspected of carrying out the stabbing.

Caption: Warsame Mohammed

Picture: West Midlands Police

Photographer: Brigg Ford

After the Court of Appeal hearing, the Solicitor General said: ‘The offender acted in a way that caused harm and suffering to the victim, before fleeing justice. A longer sentence is appropriate in this case.’

Birmingham Crown Court heard that Mohamed was arrested trying to sneak back into the UK after being spotted walking on the M40 by police in January.

West Midlands Police said it is working with Europol to trace Abdulahi Shire in order to try him for murder.

A second defendant, a 29-year-old man, was jailed in March 2017 for two years after admitting violent disorder.

description: Gang member Warsame Mohammed has had his sentence increased by the Court of Appeal over the death of Zakir Nawaz in Birmingham.
